ratings.comment: Tangental and comedically monotone. Lectures can be boring and even painful to sit through, but it's overall an interesting course and professor Gartner is always happy to answer a question or discuss.

I had a great time in Gartner's class. He is accessible, intelligent, and passionate (especially about his research area, agriculture and soil). His lectures aren't very interesting, but he is hilarious and passionate. He definitely listens, improves the class based on feedback, and will devote time to you if you talk to him one-on-one him.

Prof. Gartner is a cool dude, is passionate about the subjects he teaches, and has many great things to teach you. Beyond these attributes, however, are the mental demons I fight to actually attend and sit through extremely boring lectures that are taught and explained with in the comedically monotone voice that makes it difficult to retain focus.

Super passionate and enthusiastic about what he teaches, but his lectures were hard to follow and he often went off on tangents that were kind of random. Slides were pretty vague and unclear so you have to go to lecture in order to learn the material. Grade is based on quizzes and two papers.

Prof. Gartner was great, I really enjoyed his lectures. The exams were quite technical, and if they weren't open note I'm 100% sure I would have done very poorly on all of them. But, other than the exams, this course was great! I can truly say that I see the world in a whole new light thanks to his lectures and, man, I really love maps now.

Professor Gartner is passionate about what he teaches and most of the content covered is pretty interesting. He is funny, and always holds a two hour review session before exams which are helpful. The exams though can be difficult even if you attend lecture and pay attention. Just go to discussion which is worth more than the exams. Chill workload

I personally have had a great experience with Dr. Gartner's Geog 370: Intro to Cartography. He has great patience in answering questions, and providing resources and he loves talking to students. All the resources are provided through canvas, feedback is provided on how to improve map making. He is always a mail away and supportive.

Professor Gartner is an unforgettable professor. He is so knowledgable and passionate about the course material. I took this course for a General Education requirement but it is still one of my favorite classes I have ever taken.

Professor Gartner is so passionate about the material and teaches it in a super engaging manner, hes just a little eccentric. The course itself is really manageable, though there is a group project, so get a good partner if you can. The exams are fair and the two papers you write arent bad at all. Overall an enjoyable class.

Great teacher. Very down to earth and really cares about the topics. Tests were super fair and should be intuitive if you go to class. While the classes scope isn't the clearest, he delves into a range of topics from history to environmental science to give a very broad taste of the subject. Discussions have reasonable weekly writing assignments.

Lecture attendance is not required for this class; however, if you want to do well you must go to lectures. The slides are too vague to view without going to lecture. Professor Gartner's lectures are usually interesting and he is very passionate about the topics he is teaching. No textbook is required for this class.

Bill Gartner is cares a lot about the subjects he teaches in GEOG139. He has a really sarcastic and witty sense of humor which makes the lectures not entirely boring. Lecture attendance is not mandatory, but I found that when I would miss I would be clueless. The course material jumps around a lot and overall relates but it can be hard to connect.

Usually don't rate professors but felt the need for this one. Class based off 3 tests and 3 papers that you must complete within 48 hours after given the prompt. He goes off on tangents in his lectures so the material you're actually going to be graded on is unclear. No textbook to study off of, instead he assigns articles not useful for test. Hard

Prof's Gartner's exams aren't bad, but you need to go to lecture & study to do well. Lectures are amazing anyways--easily one of the most engaging professors I've ever had, incredibly passionate too. He forces you to think critically about a lot of the content covered in class. if you're interested in exploring geography, take this class!

Professor Gartner is great! Highly recommend you take his class, it has been one of the only classes I've taken which allowed me to think critically about events happening in our world today. Bill's a great guy and you can so easily tell he cares so much about the subjects covered in 139!

He's a really good guy with a good sense of humor. His lectures are pretty interesting, however his lecture slides can be unclear. That's really the only knock on him, as I enjoyed the semester with him. The discussion section requires attendance and there's weekly homework, but it isn't anything too crazy. The exams are a little vague, but doable.

Prof. Gartner is such a nice and caring guy. He makes class very interesting and entertaining. He's very easy to hold a conversation with and will stay after class to talk with students about the class or even about his research. Easily my favorite professor.

Gartner is a great, funny guy and is clearly enthusiastic about what he teaches. However, his class was extremely frustrating. Material was random, he never explained what was going on, and his tests were impossible because the material in lecture was almost always irrelevant to exams. I was always teaching myself. Nothing is on the slides either.

What a guy. You can tell that he's really passionate about the subject. He puts very little information on his lectures so you have to pay attention and write down things he says. Can't miss lecture, cant self study. You have to be interested in this subject to succeed. Readings are dense. Most of the readings aren't required for the exam.

Gartner is a great professor and is clearly really passionate about what he teaches. However, slides in lecture have close to no information on them, so it gets difficult to follow what's important and what is just apart of rambling on the subject. Only 3 tests including the final w/ weekly discussion activities. You gotta work for your grade.

Took geography 139 and absolutely loved the class. Gartner is super passionate about the subject matter and it makes for some interesting lectures. Lecture slides don't have a ton of info so missing class is hard, but showing up and taking good notes makes the class very do-able.

His lectures are sometimes hard to follow and taking notes is a challenge because there is little to no information on the slides. He goes off on tangents which usually makes me more confused and frustrated. The study guides are just broad topics but the tests are extremely specific so they're not much help. Don't recommend.

He isn't a bad professor, can be really funny but lectures were long and rather tedious. Labs were fun but a lot of work. Didn't really have any assigned readings and if you went to class exams weren't bad. His grading was also really fair, and the whole course was curved. Overall a pretty good pressor and a realivlely easy course.

Professor Gartner is super great! The discussion material was hard but don't let that dissuade you from taking his classes. His lectures were very interesting and his enthusiasm for the material made it exciting to learn. His slides did not really have enough information to skip class but that wasn't a problem because it was so fun. 10/10 recommend

Only complaint is that his tests are tricky and very specific. Otherwise he was one of my favorite professors. He really pushes you to form your own opinions and not accept what he says as the truth. It is clear that he enjoys what he does and wants to inspire his students. I was disappointed with my grade, but really impressed by the class.

The class is lecture heavy and you can study off of the slides for the exam, but I still found some of the questions to be challenging. Prof. Gartner emphasizes you to ask questions and challenge what he is lecturing on versus just memorizing what he tell you which I liked because he wants you to apply the knowledge to real-life senarios.

This class is not what I expected. His lectures have nothing to do with what is talked about in discussion. His lectures are very long and it's hard to distinguish what is going to be on the exam and what you don't need to know. Readings are supposed to supplement the lectures, but don't help at all. Would not recommend this class!!

He's very interesting and I loved going to his lectures. Get ready for some dad-type humor and someone who is very passionate about what he's teaching. Only (small) complaint is that some of his questions on his exam are tricky and can get extremely specific
Bill is a really nice guy in general, but since I took this as a gen ed, the class was of no interest to me. His tests were incredibly hard, but the discussion activities were graded easily.

His lectures are often very confusing and hard to follow and do not always follow what's on the slides (which also contain little to no information at all). The tests are pretty hard and half of your grade is based off of activities you do in discussion, which are generally pretty easy. No textbook, all the readings are online.

A super energetic professor with a true passion for environmental studies. Participation in discussion is really important and they take it seriously. Weekly discussion assignments are graded harshly and the tests are REALLY difficult for an intro class

he's an awesome guy with a passion for his topics. i didn't even like the class but didn't mind going because of his enthusiasm. the tests are pretty hard but it's worth it to listen to him speak in lectures. definitely recommend taking a class with Bill

Great Professor. Lectures sometimes veer off the material he quizzes on but they are interesting. You learn a lot about different ways of thinking and go over some awesome topics. Tests are easy if you do you studying beforehand. TA's do all paper grading so be friends with them. Great class. Had discussion on top floor of Science Hall.

Bill is a great professor, he is  very passionate about the material that he teaches and is very helpful. His grading is very fair and curved relative to all students in the class. Tests are very fair, he provides study guides which are basically an outline of the test. Lectures can get slightly boring, but overall one of my all time fav profs

Bill is an enthusiastic Norwegian academic with an extreme passion for geography. You can certainly strike up some interesting conversations with him about geographic, socio-spatial, and core-periphery models. The man is the King of Human Geography and in the words of Bill... "My hair is blonde so it doesn't take to much to engage me"

Prof Gartner is something else. His lectures can be boring sometimes and you may feel lost in this course at times. Other lectures can be interesting. He does know his stuff. He is filled with knowledge and is very passionate. He has one midterm and a final along with two essays. Does have some bias in his lectures but is not an issue typically.

Professor Gartner was obviously very passionate about the subject matter he lectured about.  He assigned a HUGE amount of reading, but I think it's because he really just wanted to cram as much info into people as he could in half a semester.  I'm sure a lot of people took this as a requirement, but he wanted people to share his passion.

Bill is the man.  He knows an incredible amount of information and is extremely accessible.  He loves beer and once met with my group at the rath and bought us all beer.  He also took the class out for beer after the public symposium.  Textbook was not necessary for the class, I didn't buy it and got by just fine.

Professor Gartner is to date the best professor I've had at this institution.  He is very passionate about subject matter, and he definitely does have a disdain for anything Western which I can relate to.  This course is VERY reading intensive.  It's a bit overwhelming, but I would definitely like to take another course with this professor.

The class is extremely reading intensive, but if you're interesting in Environmental Studies, it should be a relatively interesting class for you. If you have no interest in Env. Studies, it may be torture. Prof. Gartner is very passionate about what he teaches and that helps make the class a bit more interesting. Beware of his puns.

This class is easy and informative. Bill doesn't believe that exams are a good indicator of ability so there are only 2 exams. The exams are easy and the 4 written assignments are also very easy. Basically, if you come to class you are guaranteed at least a B.

Very easy. I expected a science class, and got a liberal arts class instead. Gartner is thought provoking, but contradicts himself often and makes blatantly untrue statements. Has a deep disdain for anything western and loves the noble savage. Take this to fulfill the environmental issues requirement for civil engineering.

This class is super easy. There were four really easy writing assignments and two midterms that consisted of multiple choice, true/false, short answer - all of which are pretty easy to handle if you at least look at the posted notes.  The class is kinda boring but good if you want to fulfill a social science credit.
